abstract: Former Al Qaeda operative Zacarias Moussaoui, providing testimony from federal supermax prison in Colorado, says prominent members of Saudi Arabia's royal family were major supporters of and donors to terrorist group in late 1990s; says he talked to Saudi Embassy staffer about plan to shoot down Air Force One with Stinger missile.
lead_paragraph: Zacarias Moussaoui, a former Qaeda operative, said that members of the royal family were donors in the 1990s, and that he discussed plans to shoot down Air Force One with a staff member at the Saudi Embassy.

headline.main: Moussaoui Calls Saudi Princes Patrons of Al Qaeda
headline.print_headline: Terrorist Calls Saudi Princes Qaeda Patrons

snippet: Zacarias Moussaoui, a former Qaeda operative, said that members of the royal family were donors in the 1990s, and that he discussed plans to shoot down Air Force One with a staff member at the Saudi Embassy.
